data.name: Norma Jeane
data.description: Every Spring "around down San Antone" there is a local strawberry festival in Poteet. We celebrate this festival and the arrival of Spring by using over 1 pound of fresh Poteet strawberries per gallon of Norma Jeane. This blonde ale uses two-row, crystal, and dextrine malts, Willamette and Cascade hops, honey, vanilla beans, and strawberry for a fruity and complex aroma and flavor.

style.name: Golden or Blonde Ale
style.description: Golden or Blonde ales are straw to golden blonde in color. They have a crisp, dry palate, light to medium body, and light malt sweetness. Low to medium hop aroma may be present but does not dominate. Bitterness is low to medium. Fruity esters may be perceived but do not predominate. Diacetyl should not be perceived. Chill haze should be absent.

breweries.name: Le Brewery
breweries.description:
Le Brewery is a family run business, founded by Steve Skews in 2001. We share a passion for beer which is crafted by hand using only the finest ingredients without any nasties in sight.

France is not a country noted for its beers, however, we've been on a mission to introduce good beer to Normandy. Le Brewery is located in the heart of cider country and produces British style real ale for the French market.

Our beer is brewed on a 10-barrel brew plant, with all natural top quality ingredients and live yeast for a superior taste. We produce a number of ‘house’ beers from the hoppy Norman Gold to our rich English milk stout, Odo.

data.name: Not So Dum
data.description: Starting with a classic blonde ale, subtle hints of passion fruit, and a refreshing, clean aftertaste, we then take her back to school with over 40lbs of fresh raspberries and hibiscus flowers. This summer favorite and all around crowd pleaser is sure to leave you dreaming of the beautiful sun drenched raspberry fields of Southern California.

breweries.name: Four Sons Brewing
breweries.description: Four Sons Brewing is a family owned and operated micro-brewery located in Huntington Beach, California (aka Surf City). Our family includes parents Duke and Daune Dufresne and, as you might have guessed by now, their four sons -- Deven, Derek, Drew and Dustin. You can also see why we have been known over the years as the "D Family", or simply "The D's". The family has since expanded with the addition of two daughters-in-law -- Talar and Rachel -- and grandson's Nico (so much for that "D" thing!) and Dillon. We've always been a very close family and love doing things together whether it's vacations, home improvement projects, sporting events, or just hanging out. We've long had a dream of starting our own business, and so we finally decided to take our love of craft beer, combined with our home-brewing experience, to create Four Sons Brewing. The picture below is a shot of the whole group and when you visit our tasting room you will likely see most (if not all) of us there. (Oh, by the way, we are huge LA Kings fans!). So we all invite you to come by, have a beer, and become a part of the Four Sons Family!

data.name: Nuptials
data.description: We created our Mango Blonde ale to represent the marriage of cultures for a recent family wedding. Mango, the national fruit of the Philippines, unites with our English Ale recipe in wedded bliss. It was such a hit that we were forced to make more.

breweries.name: Raw Brewing Company
breweries.description: Raw Brewing Company was created from a passion for real ale and an idea that became reality. After several years of enjoying real ale David decided to have a go himself as a hobby to see if he could produce quality real ale. After several months it was clear that the product was good with the assistance from an army of tasters! It was time then to turn this passion and idea into reality Raw Brewing Company was born.

data.name: O'Fallon Gold
data.description: The original beer from our brewery…a smooth golden ale with three types of barley, two varieties of hops and fresh Kolsch yeast. It’s cold-conditioned and carefully filtered for a clear, beautifully colored, delicious beer.

We recently moved into a new facility in Maryland Heights, MO just a few miles east from our original location. Our new location has a restaurant and bar where consumers can try a wide variety of different beers made by our brewing team.

data.name: O-RYE-N’s Belt
data.description: This Rye Blonde Ale is packed with subtle hints of mandarin oranges, pepper, and sharp citrus. The addition of rye malt helps to add a slightly spicy note in the finish and a rounded mouthfeel even in such a low-alcohol beer.

breweries.name: River Dog Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Founded in 2012 by the Gray Family, River Dog Brewing has managed to make a splash in the rising tide of the Southern craft beer scene. Under the direction of Head Brewer John Federal, we’ve created an exceptional menu of beers, from Belgian ales to sours to one of the largest barrel aging programs in the South.
When you visit the South Carolina Lowcountry, you know that it’s more than just a place. It’s a way of life. Incredible people. Amazing food. Exceptional beer – brewed in Bluffton.

data.name: Ohana Pacific Ale
data.description: One of our four flagship beers - available year round. It is a light hybrid beer that is clean, smooth and easy to drink. Slightly malty. Brewed exclusively with Helga hops grown in the South Pacific (Australia). Helga hops, derived from the noble German Hallertauer Mittelfruh hop, impart a delicate floral and herbal aroma.

breweries.name: Ohana Brewing Co
breweries.description:
To handcraft innovative beers with unique and complex tastes; to make a positive impact in our community.  Ohana Brewing Company is an artisanal brewery in the heart of Los Angeles.

Our slogan is "A fresh face in beer!" Although our production is ultra-small we will pursue a number of strategies to stand out in the craft brewing industry. Our mission is to brew innovative beers with unique and complex tastes - not to just copy what the competition is doing. To that end we are committed to avoiding "repeatability" - i.e. we will not brew any beer more than once in our first full year of operation, i.e. no recipe will be duplicated.

data.name: Ohhh, Ella!
data.description: Spicy Blonde Ale made with a unique Australian hop variety that provides a well-balanced beer that is simply indescribable. Golden yellow in color, slight melon flavors carry through to a slightly bitter finish.

data.name: Old 690 Beer
data.description: The name says it all, “Beer.”  As a  Blonde ale (the brewer calls it a lawnmower beer) it uses 2-row pale malt as the base with a bit of Crystal and wheat added to enhance the flavor.  This is a smash beer with only one type of hop throughout the brewing process.

breweries.name: Old 690 Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Old 690 Brewing Company is one of the first farm breweries to open in the state of Virginia. Our mission is to brew and serve a unique yet balanced variety of fresh craft beers including several seasonal ales that utilize crops grown on the 10 acre property. Come out to beautiful Loudoun County to see our hops and enjoy our unique tasting room Fridays, Saturdays, and Sundays where we serve tasting flights, pints and growlers to go. We have food trucks all weekend, but feel free to bring your own food. We are also family, kid and dog friendly. We also make and serve our own root beer!

If you are interested in hosting a special, private or corporate event please contact events@old690.com. Special event hours are available 7 days a week pending availability.

Looking forward to seeing you soon at Old 690!!

data.name: Old Capital
data.description: This beer is named for the Kingston area’s rich historical heritage, is reflective of traditional tastes. Simply put, it’s a golden, crisp and refreshing beer. Whether it’s out on a Saturday night with the gang, or home with dinner midweek, Old Capital’s exceptional smoothness makes a great choice for every occasion.
data.foodPairings: Lighter food: chicken, salads, salmon, bratwurst; Cheese: Monterey Jack, brick or similar light nutty cheese; Dessert: Light apricot or mandarin cake, lemon custard tart.

breweries.name: Keegan Ales
breweries.description:
Keegan Ales was founded in early 2003 when Tommy Keegan learned about an empty building in Kingston that nobody would buy because there was a defunct brewery stuck in it! (Although the building was built in the early 1800?s, the building was most recently home to the Woodstock Brewing Company.)

After months of cleaning and rebuilding, Keegan Ales brewed its first batch of beers on August 1, 2003(Tommy’s mom’s birthday) and set out hand-selling beer to local bars and restaurants early September. The first kegs of Old Capital, Hurricane Kitty and Mother’s Milk went to competition at Hunter Mountain that month. Mother’s Milk took home a gold medal and Old Capital was honored with People’s Choice: Best of Show.

After getting the brewery up and running selling draft beer, the crew at Keegan Ales turned their attention to the defunct bottling line. It had been left broken and literally in hundreds of pieces. It took months of pounding, tinkering and countless scratching of heads, but by the summer of 2004, Keegan Ales was available in 12 ounce bottles!

data.name: Old Faithful Ale
data.description:
Old Faithful Ale is golden blonde in color with a crisp body and light malt sweetness. We cold conditioned this ale to give it a pleasantly smooth character and dry palate. The domestically grown noble hops give this beer a light, floral hop aroma, making it exceptionally easy to drink.

Old Faithful Ale is only available in Grand Teton National Park, Yellowstone National Park and our pub in Victor, Idaho.

Old Golden Hen is perfect for all occasions and best served chilled. Available at 4.1% ABV in 500ml bottles and cask.

data.name: Old Main Golden Ale
data.description: Old Main Golden Ale is our lightest, most easy-drinking ale. In fact, it’s so popular with non-craft-beer drinkers that we now call it “OMG Ale!” OMG is more malty than a mass-produced American lager, with a slightly bigger mouthfeel and a richer, golden hue. It is also more hoppy, issuing forth white wine-like notes of spice, flowers, citrus, and gooseberry.
data.foodPairings: This nicely balanced, thirst-quenching ale pairs well with just about anything.

breweries.name: Second Salem Brewing Company
breweries.description: We are a one-barrel nanobrewery located in Whitewater, Wisconsin.  Our name comes from Whitewater's historic nickname.  From around the turn of the century to the 1930s, locals referred to the town as "Second Salem" due to its reputation as a site of witches' gatherings at the Witchtower (the Starin Park water tower), strange murders, unearthly creatures in the lake, and other unexplained phenomena.  South central Wisconsin is also the stomping grounds of the Beast of Bray Road, a werewolf-type creature that was sighted on numerous occasions in the early 1990s, and the Wild Man of La Grange, a strange character apprehended by local authorities in 1929.  We are not sensationalizing these strange events, figures, and architecture.  They are a part of our collective past: one that makes our town unique, and one that provides a rich variety of stories to translate into beer.

locations.name: Second Salem Tap Lounge and Restaurant

data.name: Oliver's Island
data.description: A refreshing golden ale brewed with malt and hops in perfect balance to deliver an easy drinking ale with citrus and tropical fruit notes and a crisp satisfying bite. With the addition of orange peel in the brew the beer has an enhanced refreshing flavour. Inspired by an island that sits just 2 miles from the brewery. In the 18th Century boats seeking passage through the Thames would be forced to stop there to pay gold in order to continue up river. The island also played a role in the Civil War, where Oliver Cromwell was reported to have taken refuge via a mysterious under-ground tunnel that is still yet to be found.

data.name: OMER
data.description:
OMER is a traditional blond topfermented beer with a secondary fermentation in the bottle, brewed according to an original recipe. It contains carefully selected ingredients, such as high-quality malted barley from the Loire region (France) and three varieties of aromatic hops. It is a full flavoured beer with a fruity aroma and a subtle bitterness.

Pour the beer slowly allowing the freshness of the hops to fully emerge and leave approximately 1 cm of beer (the lees) in the bottle. The ideal serving temperature is between 6 and 8°C.

breweries.name: Funky Buddha Brewery
breweries.description:
Funky Buddha Brewery was founded in 2010 in Boca Raton, Florida, and is committed to producing bold craft beers that marry culinary-inspired ingredients with time-honored technique. Our mantra is big, bold flavors, made exactingly with natural ingredients. So, for example, if we say a beer will taste like peanut butter and jelly, you can be sure you’ll smell and taste the fresh roasted peanuts and fruity berry jam. Our flagship beers such as Hop Gun IPA and Floridian Hefeweizen, also strive towards big, bold flavor. It’s who we are.

Our Brewery is located in the heart of Oakland Park’s new Culinary Arts District. The 20,000 sq-ft facility is powered by a 30-barrel, three-piece brewhouse, which feeds nearly 1000 gallons of beer per batch into our four 60-barrel fermenters - a capacity that makes us South Florida’s largest craft microbrewery. Each of our distinctive beers is brewed using the finest, all-natural ingredients, then served up unpasteurized, unfiltered, and unfussed with. We offer tours of our 20,000 sq-ft facility, rotating food trucks nightly, and growlers of our brewery fresh beer to-go.

You can sample our creations in our spacious tap room - open 7 days a week, noon to midnight - as well as in bars and restaurants all across South Florida. And of course, we still brew at our original location in Boca Raton, the Funky Buddha Brewery & Lounge, which has become a test kitchen for our more experimental brews.

See you soon for a pint! Cheers!

breweries.name: Southern Tier Brewing Company
breweries.description: Southern Tier Brewing Company was founded in 2004 by Phineas DeMink and Allen Yahn with the vision of bringing small batch brewing back to a region rich in brewing tradition. In 2003 Skip and Phin purchased the defunct Old Saddle Back Brewing Co. in Pittsfield, Massachusetts. All the equipment was removed and brought back to Lakewood, New York and set up at its new 10,000 square foot home, The Southern Tier Brewing Company. The Brewery began operations in February 2004 distributing regionally. By 2005 sales covered the majority of the New York State and the eastern half of Pennsylvania. In the beginning their two Flagship brands were a Pilsner and Mild Ale. Oh yeah they also brewed IPA! As it turned out the flagships were a flop and the IPA was a huge success. They next launched a line of seasonal beers which have gained great success. Since the beginning, Southern Tier has experienced steady growth, currently distributing to over 25% of the United States. Multiple expansions have been made to keep up with demand and the brewery continues to be innovative by producing new products.  Keep a look out for new products coming to stores near you.

breweries.name: Arbor Brewing Company
breweries.description: Our love affair with beer began in 1991 with our first batch of homebrew. Eventually the brewing operation took over the kitchen and basement and we decided it was time to look for larger digs. So with the help of family and friends, we opened the ABC Brewpub a brewery and restaurant in Ann Arbor, Michigan in 1995.

data.name: OR XATA
data.description: Horchata is a traditional, sweet, milky drink originating in Spain and Latin America that has become quite popular in Southern California, particularly with Mexican cuisine. Our take on the traditionally non-alcoholic drink is a blonde ale brewed with a heavy dosing of rice, cinnamon and fresh vanilla beans along with lactose for a litle extra creamy character. If you didn’t know better, you’d think it was carbonated horchata. The flavor is hard to describe, but for those who know it, you know you love it.
data.foodPairings: Al pastor street tacos, fresh corn tamales, homemade flan, a mariachi fiesta, followed by a siesta.

breweries.name: The Bruery
breweries.description:
A boutique craft brewery located in Orange County, California specializing in experimental and barrel aged beer. Our name is a fusion of 'brewery' with our family name, Rue.

Our calling is to create beers with character and depth using the simplest and purest of means. We do not filter or pasteurize our beers. Most of our bottled beers gain carbonation through bottle conditioning, allowing carbonation to naturally occur through a secondary bottle fermentation. We strive to use unconventional ingredients, and we will proudly state what we put in our beers.

We also have seasonal beers that will make their debut throughout the year.The preliminary restaurant to sample our product would be the Riverside, CA location which is where we brew our fine product.

Guest brewing services and our small batch craft brewery are prominently featured in our beer hall. The outdoor "beer dock" will provide casual, comfortable, shaded enjoyment of our beers

data.name: Organic Ale
data.description: Propeller Organic Ale is an easy-drinking blonde ale. This brew has a clean body, subtle malt sweetness and crisp finish. We believe brewing a certified organic beer means being all in. That's why we use only organic Pale and Pilsen malts carefully balanced with select organic hops to give this brew it's special character. Enjoy.

breweries.name: Propeller Brewery
breweries.description: Propeller Brewing Company is Nova Scotia’s best selling microbrewery. Our International award winning, all-natural, British-style ales and lagers are available at liquor stores, fine bars and restaurants throughout Nova Scotia. Ask for an Extra Special Bitter or an India Pale Ale, the Province's two best selling micro brewed beers, or drop by the downtown brewery and retail store to sample brewery fresh craft ales.

data.name: Organic Honey Dew
data.description:
Organic Honey Dew is the UK’s best selling organic beer. Light and golden with a zesty edge and a bitter-sweet flavour, Honey Dew is a naturally palatable brew that is Soil Association approved. 

Served chilled, Organic Honey Dew offers both refreshment and an unbeatable taste. The real organic honey in the brew gives a gentle sweetness that appeals to a wide range of people, even those who perhaps wouldn't usually drink beer, making it a very popular choice!

breweries.name: Weasel Boy Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Founded by Jay and Lori Wince in 2006 Weasel Boy Brewing Company began brewing operations in July of 2007. The brewpub brews mostly traditional style ales specializing in well balanced session strength offerings. 
Winners of GABF medals in both 2010 (bronze) and 2012 (gold) for their Anastasia Russian Imperial Stout, Weasel Boy is well recognized for brewing high quality products. 
The brewpub offers artisan pizza made with fresh local ingredients, supports local art and music, and regularly participates in community events benefiting local causes.

data.name: Oval Beach Blonde
data.description: An easy drinking light ale with subtle malt flavors and aroma perfectly paired with a well balanced body. Oval Beach Blonde is a great everyday pint and a perfect gateway into the world of craft beer for inexperienced beer drinkers.

breweries.name: Saugatuck Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Saugatuck Brewing Co. is a traditional Irish style pub that features 15 house-made drafts, hard cider and wines. All beer is produced on site in our 13,000 square foot Brew House. The full menu includes light snacks and unique entrees, along with home made desserts.  We offer 6 mainstay styles in bottles along with 3 seasonals and many specialties.

We feature the only brew-on-site facility in West Michigan. With five copper kettles, an array of natural ingredients, and over 100 recipes, we invite you and your friends to be the Brewmaster for a day. Create your own unique ale and return in two weeks to bottle 60 - 22 oz. bottles of fresh beer with a custom label of your choice.

The Singapore Room is our multi-purpose banquet facility. This includes a 4 tap bar, wine service and customizable menus. The Singapore Room can be rented out for a variety of events including birthdays, graduations, weddings, rehearsal dinners, etc.

data.name: Ovila Golden With Pomegranates
data.description: Pomegranates have been treasured since ancient times and used as symbols of fruitfulness and prosperity. In the modern era, they are prized for their unique sweet-tart flavor and intense red color, which acts as a perfect counterpoint for the spicy Belgian-style golden ale. This collaboration beer features pomegranates grown at the Abbey of New Clairvaux.

breweries.name: Sierra Nevada Brewing Company
breweries.description:
The Sierra Nevada Brewing Company was established in 1980 by homebrewers Ken Grossman and Paul Camusi. Camusi retired in 1998 and sold his share in the company to Grossman.

Located in Chico, California, Sierra Nevada Brewing is one of the most popular craft breweries currently operating in the United States. Its Pale Ale is world renowned, and the brewery produces almost 700,000 barrels of beer per year. Sierra Nevada's Pale Ale is the second best-selling craft beer in the United States, behind the Boston Beer Company's Samuel Adams Boston Lager.

Sierra Nevada's specialty brews include the winter seasonal Celebration, which is similar to the pale ale, but hoppier; and Summerfest, a lager which is citrusy and sunny.

data.name: Oxford Gold
data.description: Awarded Silver in the 'Golden Ales' category of CAMRA's Champion Beer of Britain (London/South East) competiton. English Target hops give this beer a remarkable aroma. Late hopping with Goldings and fermentation by the Brakspear yeast creates a remarkable zesty aroma, a full fruity flavour and a golden colour.

data.name: Pacific Ale
data.description: We were inspired to brew this style of beer by the European village breweries whose ales were brewed and delivered fresh to be enjoyed in the pubs of the surrounding local area. Pacific Ale is brewed to be served fresh in the many great watering holes just down the road; therefore we don’t need to filter or pastuerise it. We want it to be served over the bar just like it is in our storage tank at the brewery. Brewed with local water from the Byron Bay hinterland, Australian grown barley, wheat, and hops, and carefully selected ale yeast we have crafted a beer with complex flavours and a clean bitter finish.

breweries.name: Stone & Wood
breweries.description:
We established Stone & Wood Brewing Company in Byron Bay in 2008 after many years of working in the beer business. Our dream was to quit ‘working for the man’, shed the corporate garbage and get back to basics.

As the original brewers of Byron Bay we built our brewery here at the eastern tip of Australia, in a part of the world where people enjoy having a beer when relaxing after catching a wave, catching a band at the pub or just catching up with friends. It’s that sort of place.

We brew beer for times like these, beers that the locals, and the growing number of craft beer drinkers around the country, and of course ourselves, would find simply good to drink.

There’s a lot to love about Byron Bay … the beaches … the music … the people … the pubs. These are just a few of the reasons why we brew and bottle our beer in one of the greatest places on earth. This little town in Northern New South Wales has influenced everything we do at Stone & Wood.

Not only has it helped shape our philosophy of trying to take things slowly and keeping it simple, but the natural beauty, on the edge of the Pacific Ocean, and the laid back vibe were the inspiration for our beers.

‘Byron’ is a destination for visitors from around the world and we’re always grateful we get to call the place home.

data.name: Paddle Out
data.description: This golden ale is easy to drink, with a mellow maltiness thanks to Munich malt and Belgian Biscuit.  Hopped with cascade, it is citrusy and floral with a smooth finish.

breweries.name: Mother Earth Brew Company
breweries.description:
In early 2010, Mother Earth launched a unique brewing supply store and tasting room at its new Vista, CA location. Just a half mile from the 78 freeway and just minutes from the I-5, Mother Earth Brew Co. is right in the middle of the "North County Beer Triangle" in North San Diego County. 

Our business caters to home brewers seeking the highest quality, freshest ingredients and to people who enjoy sampling great beers - many of which are exclusively available at our tasting bar! Come on by for a truly unique experience, and always remember...Love Your Mother!

data.name: Paienne (Pagan)
data.description: Paienne is a top-fermenting June straw blond coloured beer. It presents aromas of malt, fruits and hops. Its well-balanced flavours are dominated by malty and fresh cereals tastes, completed by a delicate bitterness. All of this makes the Paienne an inviting and thirst-quenching beer offering at the same time satisfying tastes and a generous body.

data.name: Papelblonde Ale
data.description: Light in color, yet big in flavor, our blonde ale is part of a tribute to our favorite New England baseball team! It offers a bright clean flavor and crisp finish, but packs a hoppy twist.

breweries.name: Lawson's Finest Liquids
breweries.description: Lawson’s Finest Liquids, LLC is based in Warren, Vermont and distributes small, custom batches of unique beer through their exclusive wholesale distributor, The Beer Guy, LLC. Sean Lawson, founder and brewer, has been an avid home brewer for nearly twenty years, with numerous award winning recipes. Lawson’s Finest, with a small batch system, can custom craft specialty beers for establishments and events. Limited in availability by design, these rare beers can only be found near the Mad River Valley of Vermont.

data.name: Parched Eagle Golden Ale
data.description: Our namesake beer, Parched Eagle is what some may call a perfect lawn mowing beer. Perfect for a hot summer day, this thirst quenching offering is light, golden, and easy on the taste buds. A touch of sweetness and subtle fruity esters coupled with a kiss of hops is the mark of this classic style from Cologne.

breweries.name: Bomber Brewing
breweries.description: I suppose you could say it's a truly Canadian story - hockey, friendship and beer. From the ice rink to the brewery, Bomber Brewing is the shared dream of three friends with a passion for playing hockey and savouring good beer.   We drafted a team, combined our skills, and in February of 2014, we launched one of the newest micro-breweries to hit the Vancouver scene.

data.name: Parsons Glebe
data.description: A delicate low-hop beer with a biscuity malt character and a clean finish. This golden brew is fermented with English yeast, giving a mellow fruitiness that makes it a great sessionable beer for an easy-going afternoon.

breweries.name: Broken Bow Brewery
breweries.description: At Broken Bow Brewery, Our passion towards offering our very best is deeply personal. Family Owned and operated, our earliest brews were designed to be enjoyed with family and Friends. With those gatherings as our standard, w're committed to delivering every drop with the thoughtful attention to detail that special people and times deserve.
